results.title: Our time in the garden
results.creator_credit: Susan Woll, Ron Blau and Central Studios
results.brief_description: Fifty-year old films from the home movies of the Blau family, Berlin Jews who lived in the Grunewald until 1933. Striking impressions of a happy life before the coming of Fascism. Made by Ron Blau. Voice of Gerda Blau.

results.title: Our three r's
results.brief_description: A survey of educational services provided in the city of Glasgow. First there is a resume of curriculum and activities in primary schools, then in secondary schools, and finally the opportunities for technical training for day-release students.

results.title: Our street was paved with gold
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Albert Kish
results.brief_description: A filmmaker revisits Montreal’s St. Lawrence Boulevard—the Main—the road from the docks to the heart of immigrant Canada. This is a little Europe, a street of many languages, many Old World foodstuffs, a hundred small courtesies that make the stranger feel at home. For the filmmaker his prevailing memory is of the seventeen steps of a walk-up apartment, but for all Canadians, born or made, this film has many nostalgic links with a common Canadian experience.

results.title: Our story in stamps
results.brief_description: The production of Malayan postage stamps in Britain. Working from a basic design selected in Malaya, British craftsmen prepare and print the perforated sheets of stamps. Intricate printing processes and skilled workmanship go into their creation. Locale sequences in Malaya reveal the relationships between the symbolic designs on the stamps and the landscape, industries and crafts of the country.

results.title: Our stake in troubled Morocco
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the political unrest in French Morocco which threatens to endanger strategic American air bases in the area. Traces the causes of the dissatisfaction to an awakening nationalism in the Muslim world and to resentment of the country’s colonial status despite improvements initiated by the French government. Shows the everyday life of the people.

results.title: Our soil resources (formation and conservation)
results.brief_description: Both animation and direct photography are used to demonstrate how soil is formed, the factors which determine the formation of various soil zones, and the measures which can be employed to conserve and control and utilise soil.

results.title: Our shrinking coastline
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of erosion by the sea in some of the most severely threatened areas of the Australian coastline, in particular northern New South Wales and sourthern Queensland. No other credits.

results.title: Our school
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Graphic Films, National Union of Teachers and John Krish
results.brief_description: Tells the story of one day in the life of one secondary modern school, the Francis Combe School at Watford in Hertfordshire. Scenes of traditional bookwork, handicrafts, a visit to a local industry, give an impression of the kind of education which the best of these schools provide. Comments on the aims of the school, and some of the problems of the children and teachers.

results.title: Our puppets
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This short, fun program aims to inspire Years 6-10 Drama and Art students to explore the creative potential of puppet making and performance. It follows an energetic group of Year 7-9 students as they plan, design, construct and present their ambitious but highly successful puppet show. The program features interviews with the students and their teacher as they explore this creative medium.
